This is why you receive an error message if you try to access Peacock from abroad.

Fortunately, there’s a simple solution to bypass all such geographical barriers and stream your favorite event on Peacock from anywhere. U.S. Open Golf Championship 2024 Schedule

Here’s the complete schedule for 2024 U.S. Open Golf Championship:

When will the U.S. Open Golf 2024 start?

The U.S. Open Golf Championship 2024 will start on Thursday, June 13, 2024, and continue until Sunday, June 16, 2024.

Where will the U.S. Open Golf 2024 be played?

The U.S. Open Golf 2024 will be played at Pinehurst Resort & Country Club’s Course No. 2 in Pinehurst, North Carolina.

What is the Format for U.S Open 2024 Playoffs?

The U.S. Open’s climax is the gripping final round, crucial for boosting professional golf TV ratings. Imagine the thrill of witnessing four or five top golfers battling on the back nine. In case of a tie, the playoff format is streamlined, with a two-hole aggregate score followed by sudden death, a practical improvement over the previous 18-hole playoff system.

Who Has Won the Most U.S. Open Golf Events?

The record for the most U.S. Open victories is jointly held by four golfers: Willie Anderson, Bobby Jones, Ben Hogan, and Jack Nicklaus, each with four wins.

How to Qualify for the U.S. Open Golf 2024?

The USGA will award spots to the top 60 players in the Official World Golf Ranking who are not already exempt, as of June 10, 2024.

Local and Final Qualifying

The remaining spots are filled through local and final qualifying events:

Local Qualifying: 109 courses across 44 states and Canada host 18-hole qualifiers from April 22 to May 20, 2024.

Final Qualifying: 13 sites host 36-hole qualifiers on May 20 and June 3, 2024, awarding 3 spots each. 10 are in the U.S.1 in England, 1 in Canada, and 1 in Japan.

The majority of the field is made up of players who receive an exemption from the USGA based on the following criteria:

Win the U.S. Open in the last 10 years (2014-2023)

Finish in the top 10 at the 2023 U.S. Open

Win the 2023 U.S. Senior Open

Win the 2023 U.S. Amateur

Win the 2023 U.S. Junior Amateur, U.S. Mid-Amateur, or finish runner-up at the 2023 U.S. Amateur (must be an amateur)

Win the Masters from 2020-2024

Win the PGA Championship from 2019-2024

Win The Open Championship from 2019-2023

Win The Players Championship from 2022-2024

Win the 2023 BMW PGA Championship

Qualify for the 2023 Tour Championship

Multiple winners of PGA Tour events since the 2023 U.S. Open

Top 5 in the 2024 FedExCup standings as of May 20, 2024

2023 Korn Ferry Tour points leader

Top 2 from the final 2023 Race to Dubai Rankings

Top player from the 2024 Race to Dubai Rankings as of May 20, 2024

Win the 2023 Amateur Championship (must be an amateur)

Win the 2023 Mark H. McCormack Medal (must be an amateur)

Win the 2024 NCAA Division I Men’s Individual Golf Championship (must be an amateur)

Win the 2024 Latin America Amateur Championship (must be an amateur)

Behind the Scenes at Pinehurst No. 2

Pinehurst No. 2, nestled within the esteemed Pinehurst Resort, boasts a storied legacy dating back to its establishment in 1895. Crafted by the revered Donald Ross, its design endures as a formidable challenge for golfers, earning its place in the annals of the sport. Over the years, legends like Sam Snead, Ben Hogan, and Jack Nicklaus have triumphed on its greens, enriching its heritage. Today, Pinehurst No. 2’s affiliation with the World Golf Hall of Fame adds another layer of prestige, drawing enthusiasts to Golf House Pinehurst to explore golf’s iconic moments.

The U.S. Open week at Pinehurst is marked by special events, notably the World Golf Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony. This year, the ceremony honors Johnny Miller’s remarkable U.S. Open victory fifty years ago, underscoring the tournament’s significance in golf history. Beyond the tournament itself, pre- and post-round shows provide insightful analysis, offering fans a deeper understanding of the players and the game’s intricacies. The induction ceremony serves as a poignant tribute, immortalizing the Class of 2024’s contributions to golf’s illustrious narrative within the Hall of Fame.

Frequently Asked Questions

When and where will the US Open 2024 take place?

The 2024 US Open will be held at Pinehurst Resort’s Course No. 2 in Pinehurst, North Carolina, from June 13 to 16, 2024.

How do golfers qualify for the US Open?

Golfers can qualify through various categories, including winners of the US Open in the last 10 years, top 10 finishers at the previous year’s US Open, and top 60 players in the Official World Golf Ranking.

What are the exemption categories for the US Open?

The USGA has outlined 23 fully exempt categories, including winners of the US Open, Masters, PGA Championship, Open Championship, and Players Championship, as well as top players in the Official World Golf Ranking.

How many players are in the field for the US Open?

The field includes 156 players.

What is the prize money for the US Open?

The prize money for the US Open is $20 million, with the winner receiving $3.6 million.

Who is the defending champion of the US Open?

Wyndham Clark is the defending champion of the 2023 US Open.

How can I watch the US Open?

The event will be broadcast live on various channels, including NBC, USA Network, and Peacock TV, and can be streamed through the NBC Sports App and the USGA App.

What are the tee times for the US Open?

The tee times for the US Open will be announced in the run-up to the event, usually on Tuesday evening.
